questions.question_text: A user is trying to reach an internet destination. A systems administrator thinks that packets are being dropped in transit. Which of the following command-line tools would confirm if the packets are being dropped?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
To confirm if packets are being dropped in transit, the traceroute command-line tool would be the most suitable. It maps out the path packets take to reach their destination, highlighting where any drops or delays occur along the route.

questions.question_text: A security engineer wants to provide a secure, dedicated, alternate access method into an IT network infrastructure to administer connected devices and IT assets. Which of the following is the engineer most likely to implement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Options A (Remote Desktop Gateway) and D (Secure Shell) are common methods for remote access, but they operate over the primary network and might not offer the same level of isolation and security as out-of-band management.

Selected Answer: C
OOB is correct because it's an alternate access into an IT network infrastructure that's secure and dedicated. (Not same environment as PRODUCTION)

questions.question_text: Which of the following network types is composed of computers that can all communicate with one another with equal permissions and allows users to directly share what is on or attached to their computers?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
PAN shares network resources

Selected Answer: B
GPT: For a 10GBASE-T network in a data center where high traffic and data integrity are crucial, the network technician should consider including the following in the plan:

Shielded Twisted Pair (STP) Cabling: Since 10GBASE-T operates over twisted-pair copper cabling, using shielded twisted pair cables (such as STP or FTP) is essential to reduce electromagnetic interference (EMI) and crosstalk, which can affect data integrity. STP cables have shielding that helps protect the data signals and improve performance, especially in environments with high interference.

High-Quality Cat6a or Cat7 Cabling: For 10GBASE-T, which supports data rates up to 10 Gbps, using high-quality cabling like Cat6a or Cat7 is crucial. Cat6a is rated for 10 Gbps over 100 meters, and Cat7 offers even better shielding and performance. Cat7 cables are often used in environments requiring extra protection from interference.
The answer is B cuz, a standard released in 2006 to provide 10Gbit/s connections over unshielded or shielded twisted-pair copper cables (Category 6 or above)

questions.question_text: A network technician is planning the infrastructure for a new data center that will support a 10GBASE-T network. Traffic in the data center is expected to be high, and data integrity is very important. Which of the following would the network technician most likely include in the plan?

comments.content:
Load balancing is literally the definition and the purpose of NIC Teaming.

Per Microsoft: NIC Teaming, also known as load balancing and failover (LBFO), allows multiple network adapters on a computer to be placed into a team for the following purposes: Bandwidth aggregation. Traffic failover to prevent connectivity loss in the event of a network component failure.

So the question is idiotic, since it could be both, but I suppose "NIC teaming" isn't really a scenario, more of a configuration.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
NIC teaming (or network bonding, link aggregation) is a technology that allows multiple NICs to operate as a single logical interface.

distribute requests evenly makes me thing HA so... A? anybody care to weigh in?

questions.question_text: A company that replicated the production environment in a cloud environment is starting to use a load balancer to evenly distribute requests between both environments. Which of the following does this scenario best describe?
